comments:
Using CDT 2.0 on RHEL 3.0 with GTK on IA32 with Eclipse 3.0 M6.
Get errors with the UI when performing normal operations with the Mouse. Pairs 
of error messages appear in the error log when clicking with the mouse:
"Unhandled event loop exception"
"Widget is disposed"

This error occurs frequently and requires Eclipse to be shut down and 
restarted, since it makes the UI unusable - once these errors start, much of 
the UI becomes unavailable for mouse clicking (each click only generates the 
two error messages, in sequence).

This is not a "CDT" thing.  I have it all the time
when using GTK wiht the JDT.

You will have better luck by turnin the PR to UI platform

Can you give us a copy of the call stack? It should be found in the .log file 
(<workspace>/.metadata/.log).

Example stack trace when the exception occurs:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Mar 01, 2004 14:48:21.939
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Mar 01, 2004 14:48:21.976
!MESSAGE Widget is disposed
!STACK 0

The only way I could see this happening is if an exception occurred during the 
dispose handler for the cool bar.  It might then be possible to be a 
"half-disposed" state, in which the cool bar says it isn't disposed, but yet it 
is.  Even that seems like a stretch. 
 
If you see this bug again, please re-open.
Moving to verified to get them out of my list of bugs to verify for M9.
